channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: The big ‘carry trade’ unwind is far from over, strategists warn
item.description: Strategists have warned it is too early to give the all-clear to the rapid unravelling of "carry trades."

item.title: From 'the greatest salesman' to 'very honorable': Trump changes tack on Ukraine's president
item.description: Trump once mocked Ukraine's president as 'the greatest salesman' — now he's called him 'very honorable'

item.title: Photos show massive wildfire raging in Greece as residents near Athens forced to flee homes
item.description: Hundreds of European firefighters, backed by fire engines and waterbombing aircraft, have sought to contain the country's worst wildfire this year.

item.title: Chinese EV maker Zeekr says its new battery can charge faster than that of a Tesla
item.description: Chinese electric car brand Zeekr announced new batteries on Tuesday, which the company says offer the fastest charge in the world.

item.title: Ukraine wants more negotiating power as forces advance into Russia, humiliating Moscow
item.description: More light is being shed on Ukraine's incursion into Russian territory and Kyiv hopes it could recalibrate the war, and any future peace.

item.title: Starbucks replaces CEO Laxman Narasimhan with Chipotle CEO Brian Niccol
HelloFresh shares pop 11% as meal kit giant beats profit estimates
item.description: HelloFresh said it got a boost from healthy growth in its ready-to-eat meal delivery business.

item.title: Auctions of early King Charles bank notes raise $1.17 million for charity
item.description: Auctions of King Charles III bank notes with low serial numbers have raised £914,127 for charity, according to the Bank of England.

item.title: LVMH puts mark on Olympics as luxury brands embrace sports
item.description: The 2024 Paris Games have seen a luxury touch from Louis Vuitton Moët Hennessy, part of luxury fashion entering the sports world.

item.title: Disney is hoping for a box office rebound built on sequels, prequels and pixie dust
item.description: As Disney seeks to rebuild its reputation and recapture magic at the box office, it is relying heavily on existing, and beloved, franchises.

item.title: Elon Musk, Donald Trump event on X crashes site, Tesla CEO blames cyberattack
item.description: Trump and Musk's conversation finally kicked off after nearly an hour of troubleshooting.

item.title: The stock market should be great, not on a knife's edge. But that's the opportunity
item.description: It should be a good moment, but it isn't. Hmm?

item.title: Home Depot expects sales to weaken as consumers grow more cautious
item.description: Home Depot's CFO said homeowners are now deferring projects due to a "sense of greater uncertainty in the economy."

item.title: Unwinding of carry trade will benefit Japan, Monex Group's Koll says
item.description: Corrections in the Yen and the unwinding of the carry trade is a positive development for Japan argues an expert investor who remains bullish on the market.

item.title: Podcast: Japan's quest for the most powerful microchip leads semiconductor revival
item.description: In the 1980s, Japan was the dominant player in the semiconductor market. But huge shifts in the way the chip supply chain operated eroded that leading-edge.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Oil soars on Middle-East tensions
item.description: The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq Composite largely held on to gains in choppy trade ahead of key inflation data.

item.title: U.S. sends more forces and military hardware to the Middle East in anticipation of Iranian attack on Israel
item.description: The Pentagon ordered a guided missile submarine to the region, as well as a carrier strike group equipped with F-35C fighter jets.

item.title: SpaceX repeatedly polluted waters in Texas this year, regulators found
item.description: SpaceX violated environmental regulations in releasing pollutants into or nearby bodies of water in Texas, a state environmental agency found.

item.title: Adani Group shares shed billions after Hindenburg allegations against regulator
item.description: The group's flagship firm Adani Enterprises slipped as much as 5% in early morning deals, before paring some of its losses.

item.title: Tuesday's big stock stories: What's likely to move the market in the next trading session
item.description: Here's what's on the radar for CNBC TV heading into Tuesday's session as traders try to build on last week's big comeback.

item.title: Trump returns to X ahead of Elon Musk interview, weighing down Trump Media stock
item.description: Donald Trump announced the interview with Elon Musk on Truth Social last week.

item.title: Three-year inflation outlook hits record low in New York Fed consumer survey
item.description: Consumers grew more confident in July that inflation will be less of a problem in the coming years.

item.title: Putin vows 'worthy response' to Ukraine's incursion as 11,000 evacuated in second border region
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin vowed a "worthy response" to Ukraine's ongoing incursion into Russian territory.

item.title: Bear market is coming in 2025, warns David Roche, but the Fed will step in before it turns 'draconian'
item.description: Veteran investor David Roche predicts that a bear market is likely coming in 2025, caused by smaller-than-expected rate cuts, a slowing economy and an AI bubble.

item.title: EU warns Elon Musk ahead of Trump interview to keep hate speech off X
item.description: European Commissioner Thierry Breton warned X owner Elon Musk the company may face penalties if it doesn’t address the spread of illegal and dangerous content.

item.title: European markets close mixed; U.S., UK inflation in focus this week
item.description: European stocks on Monday closed mixed, with U.S. and U.K. inflation data set to dominate focus in the coming days.

item.title: What are the best galleries in New York? Artists choose their favorites
item.description: CNBC asked artists to name their top New York galleries, ranging from the well-known to the underground.

item.title: Europe inflation may spike on Olympics and Taylor Swift, but UBS says it won't hit locals' wallets
item.description: According to UBS, the Paris Olympics, as well as the Eras Tour, are causing demand shocks without impacting the average consumers' spending power.

item.title: Trump promotes false Harris AI crowd size conspiracy
item.description: Donald Trump has so far held one rally in August, compared with Kamala Harris' busy swing of travel to battleground states over the past week.

item.title: More than half of new cars sold in China are now electric or hybrid
item.description: New energy vehicles outsold traditional fuel-powered passenger cars in July, according to China Passenger Car Association data.
